description: An overview of the evolution of Latin American societies since 1750, this course examines the consequences of independence, 19th-century economic imperialism, and 20th-century transitions to more urbanized, industrialized ways of life. Students examine major Latin American nations and compare their revolutionary and counter-revolutionary trajectories toward the establishment of authoritarian states. Foreign Languages Across the Curriculum (FLAC) course is often available in Spanish. Offered periodically. Also counts toward Latin American studies major and concentration.
name: Modern Latin America
